author: Greg Morabito
title: Lego Fan Opens ‘Brick Burger’ Restaurant

organizations.name: lego fan opens ‘brick burger’ restaurant lego fan opens ‘brick burger

text: Lego Fan Opens ‘Brick Burger’ Restaurant Everything is awesome at this new burger joint [ Facebook/Brick burger ] A Lego enthusiast in the Philippines by the name of Jergs Correa recently kicked open the doors to a new restaurant that serves 10 different burgers , made with buns that resemble stackable colorful toy bricks. Between the patties and the brick buns, guests can get toppings like mac and cheese, bacon bits, caramelized onions, and barbecue sauce. Here’s a peek at some of Brick Burger ’s house specialties: A photo posted by Summer (@summermargarita3) on Feb 5, 2017 at 8:59am PST A photo posted by Summer (@summermargarita3) on Feb 5, 2017 at 8:49am PST A photo posted by Janine Gayle Ang Cervantes (@ninjaninejaa) on Jan 28, 2017 at 6:38am PST In addition to burgers, the Pasig City restaurant serves wings, dogs, and pasta dishes. Brick Burger’s dining room also has a Lego theme, as well: A photo posted by Cristina Garcia-Manguera (@cristinamanguera) on Jan 14, 2017 at 7:54am PST The restaurant opened six months ago in a shopping center, and it’s already very popular with the local burger (and Lego) fans. Brick Burger has absolutely no affiliation with Lego whatsoever, but the toy giant is aware that the restaurant exists: Yesterday, the company’s official Twitter account shared a surprised emoji in response to a photo of one of the dishes.
